It was our last night in Barcelona, and as always, we try to look for that one restaurant to have a memorable meal.  We just left the Plaça d'Espanya and just started wandering around to our hotel.  We passed several restaurants and then happened to come upon Ikibana.  The patio was full and we were greeted with a cheerful, "Hello, I'll be with you in a moment."  Then a hostess came out and asked if we wanted a table (in Spanish), at least that what I thought she said.  She then switched to English.  I guess my accent gave it away.We were given a high table near a wall that gave us a great view of the whole dining room.  Very relaxed and inviting atmosphere.  There were a number of diners inside and everyone looked pretty happy.  Our server, Yuri, spoke pretty good English and was very pleasant and helpful.  Even brought out some complimentary edamame during the meal.  I think he felt some of the dishes were taking too long, but we didn't think so.  I ordered a bottle of Rioja for the partner and a bottle of cava for myself, since I like champagne.  Both were great!We ordered gyoza, Ipanema 6 roll, yakisoba with chicken, and Tataki ternera, which was slices of grilled beef.  I didn't realize that the restaurant was Japanese and Brazilian fusion, but what a tasty treat!  We also ordered two desserts: the caramilho and the chocolate petropolis, which both ended the meal perfectly.Great food!  Great service!  Fun atmosphere!  This is a wonderful place to go for a special occasion or to treat yourself.  I would definitely come back when I visit this fun and vibrant city!
